detailed_results.question: Who is responsible for the code review?
detailed_results.presidio_text:
Project Update - <US_DRIVER_LICENSE> Planning

<PERSON> is the team lead for the infrastructure project. <PERSON> handles the frontend work, 
while <PERSON> manages backend services. In <DATE_TIME>'s standup, <PERSON> assigned the API 
refactoring to <PERSON>. <PERSON> will review <PERSON>'s changes before the <DATE_TIME> deadline.

<PERSON> mentioned that <PERSON>'s previous work on the authentication module was excellent, which is 
why she's entrusting him with this critical task. <PERSON> agreed, noting that <PERSON>'s code quality 
has been consistently high.

- Carol: Code review by <DATE_TIME>
- Alice: Final sign-off by <DATE_TIME> EOD

detailed_results.question: Who has final approval authority on UX changes?
detailed_results.presidio_text:
Meeting Notes - Design Review

Participants: <PERSON> (Design Lead), <PERSON> (UX), <PERSON> (Product)

<PERSON> presented the new dashboard mockups. <PERSON> raised concerns about the color contrast, 
suggesting we use darker tones for accessibility. <PERSON> agreed with <PERSON>'s feedback and 
asked <PERSON> to incorporate the changes.

<PERSON> will update the designs and share with <PERSON> for a second review. <PERSON> requested 
that <PERSON> sign off before we move to development.

Decision: <PERSON> has final approval authority on UX changes.

detailed_results.question: Who deployed the hotfix?
detailed_results.presidio_text:
Incident Report - Database Outage

At <DATE_TIME>, <PERSON> (on-call engineer) detected the outage. She immediately paged 
<PERSON> (DBA) and <PERSON> (Platform Lead).

<PERSON> identified the root cause: a misconfigured connection pool. <PERSON> asked <PERSON> to 
implement the hotfix since she had written the original connection handling code.

Grace deployed the fix at <DATE_TIME>. <PERSON> verified the database was healthy. <PERSON> 
conducted the post-mortem and credited <PERSON> for the quick resolution.

Commendation: <PERSON> for rapid incident response.

detailed_results.question: Who is Tommy's grandmother?
detailed_results.presidio_answer: Tommy's grandmother is the host of the dinner.
detailed_results.presidio_text:
Family Gathering - Holiday Plans

The <PERSON> are planning their <DATE_TIME> dinner. <PERSON> (grandmother) 
will host at her house. Her son <PERSON> and daughter-in-law <PERSON> will 
bring the turkey. <PERSON> and <PERSON>'s children, <PERSON> and <PERSON>, are excited to see their 
cousins.

<PERSON>'s daughter <PERSON> and her husband <PERSON> will drive up from <LOCATION> with 
their kids, <PERSON> and <PERSON>. <PERSON> offered to make her famous apple pie, which 
<PERSON> praised as "even better than my own recipe."

<PERSON> asked if <PERSON> could sit next to his cousin <PERSON> at the kids' table, since 
they haven't seen each other since <DATE_TIME>.

detailed_results.question: Who proposed cutting the engineering budget?
detailed_results.presidio_text:
Email Thread: Re: <US_DRIVER_LICENSE> Budget Approval

From: <PERSON> <<EMAIL_ADDRESS>>
To: Budget Committee
Subject: Re: <US_DRIVER_LICENSE> Budget Approval

Thanks for the feedback, everyone.

<PERSON>'s suggestion to reduce the marketing spend by 10% makes sense given our <US_DRIVER_LICENSE> performance.

However, I disagree with <PERSON>'s proposal to cut the engineering budget. Our roadmap 
depends on those hires.

<PERSON>, you mentioned a compromise - can you elaborate? I'd like to hear your thoughts 
before our <DATE_TIME> meeting.

<PERSON>

---
Previous messages:
- <PERSON> proposed marketing cuts
- <PERSON> proposed engineering cuts  
- <PERSON> suggested a hybrid approach
